direction.raw_text: From an AERIAL VIEW we see the outline of a city.  Any city will do.  Mirrored high rises.  Sprawling apartment complexes.  A lot of people live here...whoever they are. As we move closer we discover that this is not a real city at all, but a scale model of one. Everything is in miniature -- the buildings, parks, and freeways. GLIDING over this tabletop metropolis, we find that none of the buildings have roofs, allowing us to peak inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We FLOAT through miniature coffee shops, offices, and bedrooms, where toy figures are arranged in tableau of everyday life A man dines alone.  A woman walks her dog.  Two kiss on the street. One waits for a bus. Over this we HEAR Marianne Faithful's smoky-voiced cover of the standard "When We're Alone" Just picture a penthouse Way up in the sky, With hinges on chimney For stars to go by, A sweet slice of heaven For just you and I, When we're alone. From all of society We'll stay aloof, And live in propriety There on the roof, Two heavenly hermits We'll be in true, When we're alone. As the song ends we find a miniature girl who lies on a miniature bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOSH'S BATHROOM - NIGHT Josh washes his hands in the master bathroom.  He double-checks his neck in the mirror.  From the adjoining bedroom, we hear -- but do not see -- his wife GWEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unbelievable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm reading a stupid article in a stupid magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's stupid, why read it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ignores this) The whole issue is devoted to famous couples who are breaking up.  Listen to this...Remember the blonde doctor on that show you hate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  She's a bore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's breaking up with her husband of twenty years.  Said a friend, "Her show's in syndication, she's thin, she's rich and she wants to play." Josh dries his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some poor tree gave its life so we could know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's comforting, reading about these broken marriages. Josh opens the door into the--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen sits under the covers with her magazine.  In her late 30s, she is a refined, patrician beauty.  As Josh undresses for bed--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not enough for our marriage to succeed.  Everyone else's must fail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this going to be one of those nights?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of those nights we talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  There's no need to talk, because there's no problem. He gets into bed next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been under a lot of stress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to apologize.  There's nothing wrong with the slump we're going through.  In fact, it's a good thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that? He turns off the side light.  We can't see them -- the room is completely dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too much passion can ruin a marriage.  Look at Eric and Sylvia. At the beginning, you couldn't pry them apart.  They were joined at the genitals.  And, then...total burn-out.  A marriage cannot sustain that kind of intensity.  It's good for people to grow bored with each other.  That way, they can meet and fall in love again. She snuggles up to him, strokes his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case you hadn't noticed...I'm trying to seduce you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can feel that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're welcome to reciprocate. Josh turns on the light and sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To seduce...to be seduced, there needs to be an element of surprise. I know all your moves.  You know mine.  How can there be any surprise? Gwen sits up, throws back the sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rub my feet. He does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we should have an affair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That makes no sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You pick me up at a bar...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, what?  Pretend I don't know you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ignores him) Or we could meet at a hotel.  I'll register under my maiden name. Just like THE GRADUATE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is about a married woman having an affair with a college boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I met you, you were a college boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen, THE GRADUATE is a story about a very unhappy woman who has an affair out of wedlock.  As I recall, it turns out rather badly for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright.  Bad example. (rethe foot rub) You can stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actors pretend.  That's what they do.  I'm not an actor.  And I love you the way you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, too. And he turns out the light again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretending to be strangers is not going to solve the problem. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said there was a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OFFICE BUILDING - NIGHT A cocktail party at Josh's firm.  Josh is the center of attention, greeting investors, fielding compliments.  Gwen stands beside him, drinking champagne -- Dom Perignon, after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the crowd he spots Sarah, entering with her date -- Todd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your lovely assistant is here. (reTodd) You didn't tell me she had a new boyfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't ask her about her personal life. Sarah and Todd arrive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you two.  Todd, this is my boss Josh, and his wife Gwen. Todd and Josh shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah's told me a lot about you. Josh is not sure how to take that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah, you look great.  You've been keeping my boy on his best behavior?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a dirty job, but somebody's got to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know he asks to go above and beyond the call of duty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can be tough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But fair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh, I'm trying to thank Sarah for all the extra attention she gives you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should really have you over for dinner, Sarah.  It's been too long.  You can bring...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Todd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.  I'm hopeless when it comes to names.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Especially after two glasses of champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'm still working on the first, thank you. (to Todd) So, are you two living together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Living together?  No. Sarah and Todd both laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've only known each other a few weeks. Josh reacts -- he knew nothing of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You two seem to fit.  It only took me a few days to know with Josh.  In fact, I knew after the first date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That he was the one for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Sarah) She loves to embarrass me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Gwen) Don't stop.  I want to hear about this first date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it was the cheapest date I've ever been on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was broke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know the Chinese place on Third?  That little hole-in-the-wall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it.  Used to be a cool dive.  Now it's ultra-hip and overpriced. This news gives Gwen pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?  I think our first dinner cost a grand total of ten dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen loves to dissect our first date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a momentous night.  Babe, we should really go back there. Josh gestures to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen, why don't you continue your stroll down memory lane while I drink?  Todd, you up for it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. They move away toward--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Josh and Todd sidle up--.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to bartender) Gin.  Straight up.  Olives. (Todd) What are you having?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine, thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...Sarah's an attractive girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You two serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) Hard to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wants to play the field, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that's not it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.  You want to fuck around. Todd reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, we're guys.  I know the drill. Todd considers his audience, then decides to open up--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We dated a few times, and to be honest, I was on the fence about Sarah.  I liked her, but I didn't think we were in a good groove. Then, a couple weeks ago, her grandmother died.  Things changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know. (beat) She didn't say a thing about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't unexpected, but Sarah took it really hard.  So where did that leave me?  I was ambivalent about things, right?  But then my ambivalence had to take a back seat.  I had to be there for her.  Completely.  And, ready or not, our relationship became...a real relationship. Josh simply listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I wasn't ready to be that involved with anybody.  I don't know...Death has a funny way of making you get outside yourself. Josh looks past Todd--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen is still chatting with Sarah.  Gwen makes eye contact with Josh and sends him a warm smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOSH'S CAR - MOVING - NIGHT Josh and Gwen drive home in silence.  Gwen notices something out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You missed the on-ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somewhere we need to go first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHINESE RESTAURANT - NIGHT The Mercedes pulls up to the "Happiness Chinese Restaurant." Josh and Gwen get out and take in the sight--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have to do this tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, we do. She peers in the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't go in here.  Everything's different. He opens the door for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay.  We're different, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHINESE RESTAURANT - NIGHT Upscale lighting.  Modern, non-Chinese decor.  Anything but a hole-in-the-wall. Josh and Gwen are in a booth--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah's a very interesting girl.  Did you know she's training for the marathon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to talk about Sarah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to talk about, then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to talk about me... A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and what a fool I've been. Gwen is not prepared for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought if we came here tonight we could...start again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flustered) But I thought you were over this place.  And, look...There's nothing left.  Not one remnant of our first date...anywhere. Josh sees a plate of fortune cookies on the next table -- somebody left without eating them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (brightens) The fortune cookies haven't changed. He brings over the plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're supposed to wait--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't wait.  I have to know. He opens the first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading) "You are on the verge of success"...in bed. Gwen laughs, opens one herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading) "You will have a change of plans"...in bed. Josh reacts, opens a third.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading) "You are very creative"...in bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.  That's what I've heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last cookie.  Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  You open it. He slowly cracks in open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's blank. (checks both sides) I got a blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blank...in bed.  That's disappointing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's perfect.  Blank...no problems, no history, nothing...in bed. He takes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHINESE RESTAURANT - NIGHT Josh and Gwen approach their car.  It's late.  Behind them, the restaurant is closing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way, I didn't get your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (off his smile) Oh, my name. She glances across the street.  A shop window sign reads, "Bail Bonds."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Gail.  Gail Bonds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Gail, I'm not usually this forward on a first date, may I take you to my car and ravish you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.  On one condition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That you tell me your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I thought everyone knew my name.  I'm Bill Gates.  Billionaire. She laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOSH'S CAR -- NIGHT They get into the back seat and begin to kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it true what they say, Bill, about billionaires?  That all the wealth is just a way to compensate...for size?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People are jealous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can imagine.  It must be so lonely at the top. He reaches between her knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think I'm doing? (beat) The fortune cookie said you're on the verge of success...in bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not in a bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't read fortune cookies too literally. Josh swings Gwen onto his lap.  They go at each other like...a couple of college kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he makes love to his wife, he thinks--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Can anyone see us?...Is anyone looking?...Why should it bother you?  You're alone...with your wife...That's the way it's supposed to be...You know every inch of her...every smell...every sigh...every freckle...the shape of her ass...the mole under her nipple...the whole history of her body...And, you know that if you really concentrate, you can succeed...in imagining...she's someone you don't know... He puts his mind to it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen and her mother JOANNE are in the living room looking at samples of fabric.  At sixty, Joanne is robust and shrewd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Color.  That's the problem with this room, it needs color.  Think of...the vibrant colors of Haiti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Personally, Haiti does nothing for me.  When your father and I were there -- this was before you were born, I almost died from a piece of lettuce, and I wouldn't want anything to remind me of that trip. (beat) Anyway, quit changing the subject. Gwen puts down the swatches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright.  I didn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're not sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm sure.  I'm sure he's sleeping with her. (beat) And I may have to kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  You think I should just forget about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother, don't you think honesty is essential in a marriage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It depends.  It can be quite detrimental. Gwen begins to pace in exasperation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright.  Confront him.  You know where it will get you.  Your whole marriage will unravel, and you'll have nothing.  All the things you take for granted -- month-long vacations in St. Lucia -- they'll disappear.  You'll be a divorced woman in her late 30s.  Lonely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did I invite you over?  You make me feel like shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my job. The phone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The machine can get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't monitor calls.  It makes me feel like I'm hiding in my own home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  From the answering machine--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen, this is David Warren.  Hopefully, a welcome voice from your past.  My show's on hiatus and I'm in town for the weekend. I'd love to catch up.  Are you free for coffee...or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pick up the phone. Gwen just stares at the machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea what you're up to...I hope life is treating you well.  I heard through a friend of a friend of a friend that you're still married.  Congratulations.  If you want, give me a call.  I'm crashing at my sister's.  The number is -- hold on-- the number is 235-4511.  Hope to hear from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long has it been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: College.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever seen his show?  It's absolutely dreadful.  I never miss it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If Josh isn't home, I'll watch it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.  It's Kismet, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brief liaison with an old flame.  The perfect way to deal with your anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're insane.  You're an insane mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be good for your self-esteem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did it occur to you that maybe he just wants to have coffee? Joanne crosses to the answering machine.  Rewinds the tape. Hits play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...on hiatus and I'm in town for the weekend.  Are you free for coffee...or something? She hits stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Coffee...or something."  He's flirting, admit it.  Coffee...or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's stammering.  He's nervous.  He's calling out of the blue! Joanne gathers her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wrong.  I'm right, and I'm going.  But take a tip from someone who's been there.  Opportunity is knocking, Gwen.  You have a chance to level the playing field. (beat) You have a chance to do something good for your marriage. Joanne exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GWEN'S BATHROOM - DAY Morning.  Gwen, fresh from the shower, studies her face in the mirror as Josh -- unseen, in the bedroom -- dresses for work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right.  We could use some more color in the living room. (beat) Gwen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said you're right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About more color in the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.  I'm glad you think so. She leans closer to inspect a new wrinkle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL LOBBY - DAY An upscale hotel.  Gwen, in a sheer blouse and a slim leather skirt, fills out the registration card at the front desk.  The DESK CLERK looks up from his computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how many nights will you be staying with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do have a two-night minimum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then...two. She hands him the card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to pay in cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That won't be a problem.  We just need a credit card imprint for your incidentals... Gwen reacts.  The Desk Clerk puts her at ease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...which we tear up when you check out. Gwen smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you be needing more than one key?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL RESTAURANT - DAY Gwen and DAVID lunch in the hotel's elegant dining room.  David is quite the draw, turning heads across the room.  And, it's no wonder.  He has real magnetism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still reeling.  It was the most humbling experience of my life.  Getting raked over the coals by a bunch of sixteen-year old drama students!  At my own alma mater!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm surprised they weren't all over you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were, with knives drawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did they say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Basically, why am I working on a piece of shit like MALIBU NIGHTS when I should be doing Shakespeare or Chekhov? (beat) It was brutal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: delivers a bottle of champagne to David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Compliments from the table in the corner. The Waiter gestures.  David and Gwen turn.  In the corner three middle-aged women are smiling. David mouths a gracious "thank you" their way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See?  Those women are happy you're not doing Shakespeare. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gwen.  You look great.  You haven't changed a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think I'm MALIBU NIGHTS material.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those women!  Walking boob jobs.  They're appalling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like you enjoy kissing them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very simple.  I close my eyes and imagine I'm kissing someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.  Someone else in particular?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she's as tan as you, I don't want to hear about it. David reaches for his wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, take a look... He hands her a photo.  In it, we see David standing with a distinguished man in his mid-40s.  With them is a smiling boy, about eleven. Gwen is nonplussed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with this picture, huh? She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...Let's start with the man, upper left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy.  My partner.  And the best thing that's ever happened to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  And the boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric.  He's Andy's son from a marriage that -- needless to say -- didn't work.  Andy came out when Eric was just five.  Great kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when did you...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come out?  About fifteen years ago. (off Gwen's look) Is this too much information?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  But fifteen years ago...That was right after--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was I the last woman? David nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was I that bad? David laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you were fantastic.  I was completely confused. Gwen quickly gulps down some champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.  I'm very happy for you.  And, I have to confess, I'm relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- what the hell -- we're friends, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had this ridiculous idea that you wanted to get together to have a...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know...for old time's sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, frankly, I wasn't looking forward to turning you down. Which I would have, of course.  Had you...asked.  Which you're not, because you're...you're...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. She slides her empty glass toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you pour me a little more, David?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL LOBBY -DAY Gwen leans against the front desk.  Tipsy.  The Desk Clerk approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you, ma'am? Gwen looks lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to check out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was there a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I was stood up...by the past. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.  We won't charge you for the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I do. (beat) More than you might think. Gwen stares at him.
direction.name: direction
